dt: {bc}the relation holding between two statements if they are either both true or both false so that to affirm one and to deny the other would result in a contradiction
{bc}equality in metrical value of a regular foot and one in which there are substitutions

a presentation of terms as equivalent

dt: {bc}a set for which an equivalence relation holds between every pair of elements

dt: {bc}a relation (such as equality) between elements of a set (such as the real numbers) that is symmetric, reflexive, and transitive and for any two elements either holds or does not hold
